CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 5, 1945, pg. 8 reads: "When Presidents Meet - Mrs. Anne E. Heath, seated, center, of St. Petersburg, Fla., Connectional president of the Woman's Missionary Society of the AME Church, is surrounded by many of the women she leads. The meeting was held in Speer Street AME Church, Belle Vernon, Pa., last Friday.  Left to right: Mrs. Anna Grey of Williamsport, Mrs. Munola Muriella and Mrs. S.J. Wright of Clairton, Mrs. Agatha Fields and Mrs. Nannie Forrester of Pittsburgh.  Second row, left to right: Mrs. Anna Green, McKeesport; Mrs. Lena Jones, West Newton; Mrs. Mamie I. Brown, Belle Vernon; Mrs. M.L.C. Norrie, Braddock; Mrs. Jessie Ford, Pittsburgh; Mrs. Evelyn Wooding, Duquesne; Mrs. Virginia Thompson, Maxwell; Mrs. Edna Selby, Uniontown; Mrs. Lucille Owens, Latrobe. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Members of the Woman's Missionary Society of the AME Church, from left, first row: Anna Grey, Munola Muriella, Mrs. S.J. Wright, Agatha Fields, and Nannie Forrester; second row: Anna Green, Lena Jones, Mamie I. Brown, Mrs. M. L. C. Norrie, Jessie Ford, Evelyn Wooding, Virginia Thompson, Edna Selby, and Lucille Owens, posed in front of altar in Speer Street AME Church, Belle Vernon
